title: AutoVR.ai
description: Configuration for AutoVRai, an open-source project that automates the conversion and enhancement of regular images and videos into 3D versions for VR.

$schema.description: The path to this schema file.

model-name.description: Select the model: 'zoedepth_nk', 'zoedepth_n', or 'zoedepth_k'. The default model 'zoedepth_nk' is suitable for most use cases. 'zoedepth_n' sometimes works well for indoor close-up shots. 'zoedepth_k' may be better for outdoor, but you can test for yourself. Share your opinions and experiences with these models!

device-name.description: Select the device: 'cpu' or 'cuda'. Use 'cuda' for GPU processing, which significantly improves speed. For multiple GPUs, use 'cuda:0', 'cuda:1', etc. Basic parallel processing is supported by splitting files across GPUs (testers needed!).

precision-mode.description: Select the precision mode: 'dynamic' or 'manual'. Dynamic mode automatically scales down the precision if memory limitations are encountered. Manual mode throws an error if the defined precision fails. It is highly recommended to use dynamic mode unless there is a specific reason not to.

precision-factor.description: A number from 0.0 to 10.0 (steps of 0.0625 aka 1/16th). A factor (multiple/percentage) of 1.0 maintains the same size as the input's resolution, 0.5 halves it, and 2.0 doubles it. This affects the quality of depth information calculated, not the input or output image resolutions.

precision-width.description: Integer from 0 to 4096. This affects the quality of depth information calculated, not the input or output image resolutions.

precision-height.description: Integer from 0 to 4096. This affects the quality of depth information calculated, not the input or output image resolutions.

input-type.description: Select the input type: 'image', 'video', 'images' or 'videos'. If 'image' or 'video', the input-source is a single file. If 'images' or 'videos', the input-source is a directory containing multiple files based on input-patterns.

input-patterns.description: List of file patterns (e.g., '*.jpg', '*.png', '*.mp4') used if the input-type is 'images' or 'videos' and the input-source is a directory.

input-source.description: Input directory containing source image or video files based on input-patterns, or the full path and filename for an individual image or video.

input-depthmap.description: Only attempted if this is provided. Input directory with precomputed depthmaps associated with input-source. File names and types must match exactly; otherwise, the depth information will be generated. The depthraw files take priority if available.

input-depthraw.description: Only attempted if this is provided. Input directory with precomputed depthraws associated with input-source. File names and types must match exactly; otherwise, the depth information will be generated.

output-stereo.description: Only created if this is provided. Output location for stereoscopic results as a directory or explicit file name and path, depending on input-source.

output-padded.description: Only created if this is provided. Output location for padded version of stereoscopic results as a directory or explicit file name and path, depending on input-source.

output-anaglyph.description: Only created if this is provided. Output location for anaglyph (red/blue) version of results as a directory or explicit file name and path, depending on input-source.

output-depthmap.description: Only created if this is provided. Output location for 'colorized' grayscale version of depth information as a directory or explicit file name and path, depending on input-source.

output-depthraw.description: Only saved if this is populated. Output location for raw unaltered depth information as a directory or explicit file name and path, depending on input-source. These files are useful for later use as input-depthmap files and are more performant than depthmaps.

padded-color.description: The color to be used for the background/padding. This should be a hex RGB color string such as '#000000' for black.

padded-factor.description: A number from 1.0 to 5.0. A factor (multiple/percentage) of 1.0 maintains the same size as the input's resolution and would do nothing. A value of 3.0 would triple the width/height placing a padding area equal to the original on each side. This is the final size of EACH eye after being padded. This can help some image/video viewers to prevent zooming in too much.

padded-width.description: Integer from 128 to 4096. This is the final size of EACH eye after being padded. This can help some image/video viewers not over scale and zoom in too much.

padded-height.description: Integer from 128 to 4096. This is the final size of EACH eye after being padded. This can help some image/video viewers not over scale and zoom in too much.

stereo-intensity.description: Control the intensity of stereoscopic divergence (3D effect) by adjusting the left and right eye perspectives. Values range from 0.0 to 10.0, but 1.0 to 3.0 is recommended. Too low values may not produce noticeable 3D effects, while too high values may cause eye strain.
